results.title: Sai Baba: his life is his message
results.creator_credit: Richard Boch and Spiritual Advancement of the Individual Foundation
results.brief_description: Traces the life of Sai Baba, the leader. The film visually records Sai Baba’s many miracles as they happen, through the eyes of a scientist. The film also carries the universal message of Sathya Sai Baba.

results.title: Hiro: the Hiroshima generation
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, Fuji-TV and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: While interviewing a Japanese student, the cameras show the diversity of Japan’s youth. Shows the clashes and the integration of foreign ideas as the young people struggle for an understanding of Japanese culture 25 years after the bomb.

results.title: Hinduism and the song of God
results.creator_credit: Elda Hartley, Irving Hartley and Hartley Productions
results.brief_description: Introduces the philosophy and religion of Hinduism, emphasizing the concepts of self-realization as expressed in the Bhagavada Gita. Deals with purpose in life the four yogas, the law of karma and the four stages of life.

results.title: The Hindu world
results.brief_description: An historical and cultural survey of Hinduism, set against a background of ancient temples and statues, and Hindu religious rites. Stresses the various mental and physical disciplines called yogas, through which Hindus seek eternal union with Brahma, the universal spirit of God. Also the caste system, the belief in reincarnation and the deep influences of the religion of the Hindu way of life.

results.title: Hindu family
results.brief_description: Describes the marriage of the daughter of a Brahmin and the customs of old and new India as they are reflected in the daily life of a Hindu family in the village of Atgaum in the province of Gujarat.

results.title: Himalaya: life on the roof of the world
results.brief_description: Discusses the relative position, importance and size of the Himalayas, their geological history and the origin of the monsoon rains and how the rivers from the roof of the world have built the valleys and civilizations of Asia. Customs and ways of living have not changed much and all the canyons share in a common Indian culture. Also the pervading influence of Tibet are shown in three simple canyon civilizations: Buddhist Sikkim, Hindu Ganges Canyon and Islamic Kashmir.

results.title: Highways in action
results.brief_description: Planning and execution of modern roads and bridges in Japan, showing advanced methods to cope with heavy urban traffic in Tokyo and designs for open country where appearance as part of the landscape is as important as function.

results.title: Highways challenge
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: This film deals with Australia’s road problems. Describes how each member of the public is dependent upon road transport and points out that poor roads increase prices. Shows how cheaper methods of road transport can eventually be more costly. Suggests that the correct approach to the problem is lacking and offers a solution. Commentary by David Low.
